page.title: 06 DANBURY PALACE
page.content: Danbury Palace began to be built as a home for Mr John Round in 1828 and was completed by 1832.The building was known as Danbury Park at this time but the name changed to its present name in 1845 when it became the Bishop of Rochesters house.In its time the Palace has been used as a Maternity hospital and in 1945 the Queen presented a layette to the 2,000th baby born there.The Wigans who owned the building at that time left in 1946 and Essex County Council, who had bought the property,used it as a Civil Defence training centre.In 1969 it was taken over for use by Mid Essex Technical Collage and in 1972 the Anglian Regional Management Centre was formed.The Residential unit was completed and opened in the summer 1974.It is used for business purposes, and for social events.
